Key Arguments: The legislation will harm Australians by silencing them.
The government should protect individual rights, not suppress them.
The government's past attempts to define misinformation, particularly during the pandemic, have been flawed.
Censorship during the pandemic was proven wrong as vaccinated individuals still contracted Covid-19.
Granting more power to a single agency could lead to unchecked changes influenced by activist pressure.
The legislation threatens free speech and positive changes that result from it.
Notable Quotes: The Commonwealth is responsible for protecting the rights of the individual, not suppressing them.
This one example shows why giving the government even more power is a recipe for disaster.
This bill must be thrown out.
